page_props.text: Our faculty are essential to achieving Emory’s vision of an inquiry-driven, ethically engaged, and inclusive intellectual community.

props.header: Investing in Emory’s faculty and their research, scholarship, and publications will elevate students’ educational experiences, reinforcing Emory as a destination for future students and faculty.
props.text: Faculty are the heart of Emory University. Everything we accomplish—from world-altering research and artistic expression, to the outstanding liberal arts education that has long defined our university—is powered by our professors. As we look to the future, we need to recruit and retain the most talented and accomplished faculty in the world. A faculty diverse in thought, experience, and background that strengthens our university, and is integral to our eminence today and in the future. That means National Academy members but also extraordinary early- and mid-career faculty who are poised to make pioneering discoveries and transform their disciplines.
props.media_alt: A faculty member connects with a student.

props.text: One of our biggest needs is to endow faculty positions. In academic terms, that’s the currency for prestige, it’s the currency to make the university run. And we need the ability to attract, keep, and nourish the talent that we have.
props.attribution: — Ravi V. Bellamkonda, Provost and Executive Vice President for Academic Affairs

props.title: New Professors, Thanks to New Endowments
props.body:
In teaching their niche areas of expertise , conducting research, and gaining further prominence in their fields, Emory faculty members are fundamental to both the learning process and our ability to attract new faculty members. Investing in new distinguished professorships across schools means investing in academic rigor and thought leadership that produces top notch graduates ready to deliver meaningful, lasting contributions to society.

One of the most significant philanthropic contributions you can make, endowed professorships enable Emory to recruit and retain the highest-quality faculty members and maintain the university’s prominence. Endowed professorships enhance the student experience schoolwide, increasing academic rigor and the number of co-curricular experiences available to students across disciplines.

Endowed professorships provide research funding to support the work of the faculty members who hold them. In an era of increasingly constricted federal funding, reliable research support is essential to attracting the best faculty. Endowed professorships may be named after the donor or in honor of someone whom the donor specifies.

props.media_byline: Featured: Tim Lian, William Henry Emerson Professor of Chemistry, Emory University

props.title: Building our Faculty Bench
props.body:
We’re always looking to add the highest caliber of teachers and researchers to Emory’s braintrust, and establishing a faculty recruitment pipeline will enable Emory to attract teachers and researchers who are emerging as leaders in their fields.

Our faculty recruitment pipeline wouldn’t just focus on established educators, it would support postdoctoral fellows from underrepresented groups in transitioning to academic roles. Bringing new talents and fresh perspectives into our educational system will further strengthen Emory’s curriculum and better prepare our students for emerging priorities and trends.
props.media_text: Establishing a faculty recruitment pipeline will enable Emory to attract teachers and researchers who are emerging as leaders in their fields.
props.media_byline: Featured: Eric Weeks, Director, Center for Faculty Development and Excellence and Associate Vice Provost for Faculty Affairs

props.title: Elevating the Best
props.body: An endowed chair held by a faculty member is the single highest honor that can be bestowed by a department on its faculty. Professorships help Emory recruit and support senior-level clinicians, teachers, and researchers, particularly those who have done work of singular importance in their fields. The designation of endowed chair allows senior-level faculty to further their research endeavors, deepen their scholarship, and explore promising medical techniques and treatments as they seek federal funding. Endowed chairs advance a school, department, and area of academic or clinical interest, while honoring both a distinguished faculty member and the individual the chair is named for.

items.title: Research is Power
items.description:
As a leading research university, Emory’s focus is the number of lives saved, partnerships forged, and discoveries driven. Without research, we can’t answer the big questions, uncover new insights, make scientific or medical breakthroughs, or find solutions to the challenges communities face today, and in the future. Exciting research in the humanities, social sciences, law, and theology is uncovering how to advance social and racial justice. Our scientists and biomedical researchers are working toward eliminating cancer and the effects of brain traumas. Future modeling is helping us understand how artificial intelligence can better serve humanity. Fundamental for professors in a multitude of fields, research leads to new ideas and profound discoveries, keeps their academic and educational priorities fresh and relevant, and helps propel their careers and professional reputations forward. Funding through 2O36 offers faculty resources to purchase needed equipment and software licenses, pay support staff, and afford travel for field research.

Funding faculty research will help us recruit and retain faculty members. Research discoveries inform new academic pedagogy, create new knowledge, and lead to publication opportunities that can reach new audiences and win awards. Faculty research prepares our students to lead with the greater purpose of serving humanity.

items.title: Collaboration Rounds Out Curriculum
items.description: In addition to the research faculty conduct on their own, students have a unique opportunity to take part in research programs as a part of their learning experience. Through your support for 2O36, we can create an endowed fund for student-faculty collaborative research so that more students can have access to valuable research experience. Collaborative projects bolster students’ educational experience and prepare them for professional opportunities. They also enable Emory to compete with top liberal arts colleges and research universities, better positioning Emory students for exceptional career trajectories upon graduation.

items.title: Promoting Faculty Scholarship
items.description:
Access to flexible development funds is crucial to retaining and developing widely respected faculty. Financial support for faculty development endowments through 2O36 allows faculty to focus on research and scholarship in their fields, ensuring they establish or maintain their own prominence and that of their school.

Faculty development endowments will improve faculty retention and productivity and help Emory attract more diverse talent. Funds can support academic leaves for faculty to participate in fellowships opportunities that enhance their professional development, create or further meaningful collaborations with peer institutions, and lead to new educational paradigms, curriculum, and learning models.

items.title: The Faculty of the Future
items.description:
Through generous endowment support, Emory will be a destination, rather than a stepping stone, for leading faculty. Your support of 2O36 helps us create new distinguished professorships to attract faculty who are gaining prominence in their disciplines and retain rising stars at Emory who may have been considering taking their talents to other universities.

By pursuing early- to mid-career faculty, we will increase the number of faculty who are members of international academies and garner additional research funding at every level. Because of the caliber of our faculty and research ecosystem, Emory faculty will be more sought out as international commentators on important issues in forums that define public scholarship.

items.title: Supporting Fellowships and Residencies Through 2O36
items.description:
As a thriving and growing center for the TV and film industry and a mecca for artists, there’s creativity to be researched or experienced around every corner in Atlanta. The arts are a golden opportunity to bring Emory to Atlanta, and Atlanta to our students, through performances, collaborations, and the engagement of local visiting artists, fellows, and teachers. These experiences enhance the undergraduate experience, expand access, and create lasting, productive partnerships across creative disciplines.

Funding fellowships and residencies for faculty across film, music, dance, theater, and creative writing, and hosting internationally-respected artists offers faculty and students alike opportunities to take big risks. By focusing on careers in the arts that align with their passions over potential profits, they can change the world by changing hearts.
